text: Cassidie Cierra Burdick (born September 30, 1993) is an American basketball player for the Las Vegas Aces. ==High school== Burdick graduated from David W. Butler High School in 2011. She was one of five finalists for the Naismith National High School Player of the Year award in 2011. ==College== Burdick graduated from The University of Tennessee in 2015. Burdick was named a UT Torchbearer in 2015. ===Tennessee statistics=== Source {| class="wikitable" |Year |Team |GP |Points |FG% |3P% |FT% |RPG |APG |SPG |BPG |PPG |- |2011-12 |Tennessee |36 |165 |46.3% |33.3% |76.1% |2.8 |0.9 |0.3 |0.6 |4.6 |- |2012-13 |Tennessee |27 |227 |45.3% |35.3% |76.6% |6.6 |1.5 |0.9 |0.8 |8.4 |- |2013-14 |Tennessee |35 |306 |39.3% |36.0% |75.9% |7.3 |2.0 |0.6 |0.4 |8.7 |- |2014-15 |Tennessee |34 |374 |43.7% |37.1% |82.5% |7.6 |2.7 |1.1 |0.5 |11.0 |- |Career | |132 |1072 |43.0% |36.0% |78.4% |6.0 |1.8 |0.7 |0.6 |8.1 |} ==WNBA== Burdick was drafted by the Los Angeles Sparks in 2015, but was cut before the season began. She then signed with the Atlanta Dream.Cierra Burdick signed by WNBA's Atlanta Dream - GoVolsXtra Story Her career includes stints for the New York Liberty and the San Antonio Stars, before the latter was sold and moved to become the Las Vegas Aces. On July 31, 2020, Burdick signed a contract with the Aces to resume her WNBA career. ==International basketball== Burdick was a member of the following teams. In total she won four gold medals. *2010 FIBA U17 World Championship - Gold medal *2009 FIBA Americas U16 Championship - Gold medal *2009 FIBA Americas U16 Championship for Women - Gold medal *2011 USA Basketball U19 World Championship Team *2010 USA U17 World Championship *2009 USA U16 National Team ==Personal life== Burdick's great grandfather played for the Chicago Bears. She has a younger brother and two younger sisters. title: Cierra Burdick
